item.title: Opera TV browser
item.description: The Opera TV Browser, optimized for ease of use and long-tail content on Linux and Android based TVs, set-top boxes and Media- players, is built on Opera´s experience of bringing web browsing to 250 million mobile and PC-users world wide.

item.title: What's new in Opera Mini Next and Opera Mobile 12
item.description: Check out the latest news and features in Opera Mini and Opera Mobile! Features include: - WebGL for Opera Mobile - A brand new smart screen - Unlimited Speed Dials!

item.title: Smarter browsing
item.description: Look at all the features available in the Opera browser. Opera is available for Windows, Linux and Mac and can be downloaded for free from http://www.opera.com/

item.title: Opera Labs: Mobile Extensions
item.description: We're pretty excited to share with you a Labs release of our mobile browser with support for extensions.

item.title: HTML5
item.description: It's time for some industry insights of HTML5 from Opera's Bruce Lawson and Zi Bin Cheah. What is HTML5? What is the future of apps vs websites? What cool stuff can HTML5 do? Find out in this episode of Opera Tech Break!

item.title: A whole new way to read on the Web
item.description: Håkon Wium Lie demonstrates a new technology which changes the way we are able to read on the Web today. This demo was given at Opera's Up North Web. For more information, check out our developer article for information: http://bit.ly/pagedmedia

item.title: Opera Employee VS Taser X26 Stun Gun (AKA The World's Most Powerful Stun Gun)
item.description: During the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, newly hired Opera employee Ed Palumbo volunteered to be electrically shocked with the Taser X26 stun gun - The World's Most Powerful Stun Gun.

item.title: WORLD RECORD SPEED TEST
item.description:
This is a world record speed test. So there you have it. Download Opera from http://www.opera.com/
Get more news about Odd and Even on their My Opera blog: http://my.opera.com/odd-even/blog

item.title: Opera TV Store
item.description: Opera TV Store, a one-stop source for web applications that work on TV

item.title: The Web is what I do
item.description: Opera compresses data by up to 80%. Start browsing faster on your mobile device and save money by downloading Opera from http://m.opera.com/ today!

item.title: Speed Dial Extensions
item.description: Rich Tibbett and Arnstein Teigene talk about the fine balance between innovation, performance and stability in creating a new version of the Opera browser, focusing on Speed Dial extensions.

item.title: Live Speed Dial extensions
item.description: How to install dynamic Speed Dial extensions in Opera 11.50

item.title: Synchronize passwords with Opera Link
item.description: Learn how to synchronize passwords with Opera Link. Read more about Opera Link at http://www.opera.com/link/

item.title: Meet our new Speed Dial
item.description: Speed Dial gives an overview of your favorite sites. Find out how it works and download Opera for free from http://www.opera.com/

item.title: Synchronize with Opera Link
item.description: How to synchronize your Speed Dial across all your devices using Opera Link in the Opera web browser. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Opera Dragonfly Eats Bugs
item.description: David Storey answers all your questions about Opera Dragonfly, a debugging tool integrated into the Opera browser that makes your life easier when developing web sites and applications.

item.title: Developers guide to Speed Dial extensions
item.description: Arnstein from Opera explains Speed Dial extensions. For more information visit http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/creating-opera-speed-dial-extensions/

item.title: Meet Opera Dragonfly
item.description: Opera Dragonfly is a full-featured development and debugging tool integrated into the Opera browser. It requires no additional installation or setup, and works across many of Opera's browsers and Opera Presto based products, such as Opera Mobile and Opera Widgets.

item.title: High speed small talk in race car
item.description: Christen Krogh small talks with Aleksander Aas, Opera's Community Representative, about Opera Turbo and how it is to work for Opera. In a race car.

item.title: Opera Turbo
item.description: Opera Turbo is a feature in the Opera web browser which makes your Internet really fast on slow networks. You can download Opera for free from http://www.opera.com/

item.title: Christen Krogh from Opera talks about Opera Turbo
item.description:
We spent a record budget on this video. Check out the story behind it: http://www.opera.com/press/releases/2011/04/12/
Christen Krogh from Opera talks about Opera Turbo, a technology that makes your Internet really fast. Learn more and download a really fast web browser from http://www.opera.com/

item.title: Top keyboard shortcuts in Opera for Mac
item.description: How to use keyboard shortcuts in the Opera browser for Mac. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Top keyboard shortcuts in Opera
item.description: How to use keyboard shortcuts in the Opera web browser. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Reopen closed pages with Closed Tabs
item.description: How to recover closed webpages in tabs using Closed Tabs in the Opera web browser. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Synchronize with Opera Link
item.description: How to synchronize your Speed Dial across all your devices using Opera Link in the Opera web browser. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Zoom for easy viewing in Opera
item.description: How to use zoom in the Opera web browser to to make content easier to see. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Speed up slow connections with Opera Turbo
item.description: How to use Opera Turbo to reduce the size of transferred webpages by compressing them, and boost your webpage download speed. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Panels in Opera
item.description: How to use panels in the Opera web browser. Learn more about our latest products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Search keywords in Opera
item.description: How to use search keywords for quick and easy browsing in the Opera web browser. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Tab stacking in the Opera browser
item.description: Updated video on how to stack your tabs in the Opera web browser. Learn more about our products and innovations at http://opera.com.

item.title: Internet on Your TV
item.description:
Please take a break with Aneesh Rajaram at Opera Tech Break to show you how Opera is going to bring Social TV to your living room.
Find out how the future of TV browsing will look like. Read and subscribe to our blog for the latest news: http://my.opera.com/techbreak/ and more about the Opera web browser at http://www.opera.com/browser/

item.title: Preview of social browsing on your TV
item.description: For the next Opera Tech Break episode, we will give you the details how Opera will connect your TV to the Web. Stay tuned at http://my.opera.com/techbreak for more details!

item.title: A sneak preview of our upcoming WebGl demo
item.description: Check out this preview of our upcoming WebGL demo. Opera on hardware acceleration == really fast browser.

item.title: The Web Will Last for 500 Years
item.description: Please take a break with our CTO Håkon Wium Lie - the father of CSS - at Opera Tech Break to answer your question regarding his vision of the web, and the latest plan for CSS3.

item.title: The Future of Mobile Apps
item.description: Take a break with us at the very first episode of Opera Tech Break video - featuring Sagar Chandna - to answer all the questions you want to know about the future of mobile apps.

item.title: Opera for Tablets preview
item.description: This is the first preview of Opera for tablets. Stay tuned at http://www.opera.com for more information soon.

item.title: Meet Opera 11
item.description: New innovations include tab stacking, a safer address field, visual mouse gestures and extensions. Opera 11 is available for Windows, Linux and Mac and can be downloaded for free from http://www.opera.com/

item.title: Tab stacking in Opera 11
item.description:
Download and try the new beta of Opera 11 from http://opera.com/browser/next
Opera pioneered powerful tabs. In Opera 11, tab stacking lets you drag one tab over another to create a group. Now, you can keep dozens of webpages open, organized and under control.

item.title: Odd and Even dig a hole to Norway
item.description: The Johansen brothers are at it again. They need to find a way back home and decides to dig a hole back to Norway.

item.title: Odd and Even at the zoo
item.description: Today the brothers went to the zoo and saw polar bears with black eyes.

item.title: Odd and Even has arrived in Bejing
item.description: The brothers have arrived in Bejing. Who would've thought? http://my.opera.com/odd-even/blog/

item.title: Odd and Even go to China
item.description: Maybe tomorrow? Who knows. Watch and find out. http://my.opera.com/odd-even/blog/

item.title: Odd and Even Compressing Web Pages
item.description:
Meet Odd and Even who have been working dag og natt to help Opera fine-tune Opera Turbo before the release of Opera 10. Follow their adventures on their blog:
http://my.opera.com/odd-even/blog

item.title: Opera in Prague
item.description: We are doing a photo shoot in Prague this week. These images will be used in our upcoming autumn and winter campaigns. Check out what we managed to do after the first day...

item.title: Opera Face Gestures
item.description: Opera's known for thinking ahead. We recognize the future importance of touch interfaces, but there's one surface we haven't yet touched (literally). Get ready to face the future...

item.title: One Web
item.description: A day in the life of an Opera user with only One Web

item.title: Things you can do with Opera Mini
item.description: This video shows some of the things you can do using Opera Mini. Get concert tickest, add RSS feeds, check out events and news, etc. You can give your existing phone iPhone like capabilities now by downloading Opera Mini at www.operamini.com

item.title: Sketch of my life
item.description: Life is all about choices, so here is a short film about it. We want you to choose the best Internet experience, so why not choose Opera? You can check out more information about Opera at www.opera.com

item.title: The Catalan Job
item.description: Opera Mini MINI Cooper cars owning the streets of Barcelona.

item.title: Opera Mini Euro Cup 2008 ad
item.description: Check out how to stay updated on live scores with Opera Mini.
